newsitem.title: UK: China cosmetics market seen growing 22 pct a year.
newsitem.headline: China cosmetics market seen growing 22 pct a year.

text.p: China's cosmetics market is expected to grow 22 percent a year through the year 2001, as personal incomes continue to rise and taboos against cosmetics disappear, a market research group said on Thursday.

Datamonitor, in its report "China: New Revenue Opportunities in Cosmetics and Toiletries", said the Chinese cosmetics market was valued at 18.10 billion yuan ($2.2 billion) in 1996, up from 4.88 billion yuan in 1992.
"Where once the use of make-up was frowned upon as an indication of moral laxity, Chinese cultural attitudes to such products have become more enlightened in recent times," Datamonitor said.
Skincare accounted for 13.48 billion yuan of the Chinese cosmetics market in 1996 and is expected to continue to be the dominant sector through 2001, growing to 33.14 billion yuan, Datamonitor said.

"However, the value of the fragance and make-up sectors will rise faster, increasing by 31 percent and 26 percent, respectively, every year between now and 2001 and reaching values three times greater than they are today," Datamonitor said.
